page.title: 08TRANSPORT
page.content: The transport system of Garstang is good for a town of this size.Very close by the A6 trunk road is used by both large and small vehicles alike.The road links the towns of Lancaster and Preston with the city of Manchester. Even more important is the M6 motorway which is one of the major routes used nationwide.The motorway gives easy access to Scotland,The Midlands,London and the South,both for haulage firms, private motorists and business men.Within Garstang itself there are five different bus services and a taxi firm.Further afield in Preston there is a main line railway station which can connect with any town or city in this country.The Lancaster Canal offers an unusual mode of travel. Ferry services to the Isle of Man and Ireland are offered at Heysham and Liverpool respectively.
